title: RoboLegs - The Adventure Rental Platform
summary: High-end gear like exoskeletons is costly and often sits idle, with no clear way for owners to earn. The market lacks a trusted platform connecting users and owners.

sub_fields.title: Describe what makes your idea innovative compared to what has been previously launched in the market (whether by you or others).
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
This project introduces a new model: “Exoskeleton × IoT × Web3 Rental Platform.” Unlike traditional gear rentals, RoboLegs innovates by:

• Verifying deposits, payments, and rental records entirely on-chain

• Using IoT for real-time device monitoring and safety management

• Leveraging Cardano to build a transparent credit system that resolves disputes and trust issues in traditional rentals



Cardano’s eUTXO model, low costs, and verifiability provide structural advantages for rental services, offering a replicable template for future shared-equipment platforms.

sub_fields.title: Describe what your prototype or MVP will demonstrate, and where it can be accessed.
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
The MVP will demonstrate the following flow:



1. Users browse devices → map positioning → place reservation
2. Lock deposit & trigger auto-payment on the Cardano Testnet
3. Scan QR code → unlock the physical device
4. IoT uploads real-time device status (location / battery / in-use)
5. End of rental → return → deposit auto-settlement



All interactions will be publicly verifiable on the Cardano Testnet.

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
1. User Flow



RoboLegs provides a fully on-chain verifiable rental process covering browsing, deposit payment, device unlocking, usage, and return. The complete user journey is as follows:



Browsing & Locating Devices



Users view available Robotic Hiking Legs in the app, including map location, status, battery, and other IoT data.



Reservation & Deposit Payment (Locked on Cardano)



Users select a rental time and send a deposit transaction to the smart contract.



Deposit is locked on-chain



Rental order is created



User-device matching is completed



QR Code Scanning & Device Unlocking (IoT & QR)



Upon arrival, users scan the device’s QR code.

The system verifies the on-chain deposit → the device unlocks automatically.



Real-Time Usage (IoT Synchronization)



The IoT module continuously reports:



GPS location



Battery level



Usage status (active / standby / abnormal)



Device Return



Users return the device to a designated location; the system verifies the return and device condition.



On-chain Auto Settlement



Deduct rental fee



Refund remaining deposit



Record rental history (verifiable & tamper-proof)



This flow eliminates trust and dispute issues found in traditional rentals and ensures every step is verifiable on-chain.



2. Technical Architecture



The system architecture consists of four major modules: App, IoT, Backend, and Cardano Smart Contracts.



1. Frontend App (Web / Mobile)



Framework: Flutter / React Native

Functions: Maps, device browsing, reservation, payment, QR login & device unlocking

Blockchain Interaction: Cardano Light Wallet / CIP-30



2. IoT Device Module



Hardware includes:



GPS module



Battery monitoring



Usage-state sensors



LTE / LoRa connectivity



MQTT / REST API for backend communication



Device periodically sends:



Location & battery



Status (active/idle/error)



Unlock/lock event logs



3. Backend Service



Tech: Node.js / Python

Functions: Device state management, order management, alerts

Database: PostgreSQL / Supabase

Cardano Integration: Ogmios / Koios / Blockfrost



4. Cardano Smart Contract Layer (Plutus / Aiken)



Responsible for:



Deposit locking



Rental fee deduction



Automatic settlement



Uploading rental history on-chain



Uses the UTXO model to securely implement deposit + payment workflows.



3. Feature Modules

1. Rental App Features



Device browsing (list + map)



Reservation system



On-chain deposit payment



QR code unlocking



User dashboard (history, deposit status, invoices)



2. IoT Monitoring Dashboard



Real-time GPS & battery monitoring



Alerts (lost, offline, low battery)



Usage status dashboard



Maintenance management



3. Cardano Payment System



Smart contracts handle:



Deposit locking



Fee deduction



Automatic refund



On-chain transparent records:



Rental start/end



Contract execution logs



Device proof-of-state (optional)



4. Admin Dashboard



Device health



Rental order management



User credit scoring



Analytics (usage time, revenue)



4. Why Cardano



RoboLegs relies heavily on trust, transparency, and automated settlement — perfectly suited for Cardano.



1. UTXO model is ideal for deposit & payment workflows



Deposits can be locked in dedicated UTXOs



Fees and refunds can be completed in a single transaction



Easy to verify, immutable, strongly structured



Compared with EVM escrow contracts, Cardano’s UTXO approach is simpler and safer.



2. Secure and low-cost for high-frequency transactions



A rental platform generates many small transactions:



Deposits



Fee deductions



Refunds



Status logs



Cardano’s low fees and network stability reduce operational cost.



3. On-chain identity (DID) enables a rental credit system



Future integrations:



On-chain credit history



Safety usage score



Optional identity verification



Ideal for long-term trust and rental reputation building.

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer: This milestone delivers the technical foundation required for Aetherium. It includes designing and implementing the core payment logic that will be used throughout the simulator and the VS Code debugging workflow. During this phase, the team will create the initial architecture for the transaction flow, validator logic, UTXO handling, and script evaluation pipeline. The core simulator prototype will allow command-line execution of basic contract interactions, providing a minimal reproducible environment for validating the system’s behavior. Documentation outlining architectural decisions, module interactions, data flow, and future extensibility will also be produced. Together, these outputs ensure that the remaining milestones can be built on a stable, well-structured foundation.

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer: This milestone introduces an interactive VS Code extension that provides the frontend interface for the Aetherium debugging environment. The extension will implement project detection, Plutus script loading, metadata parsing, and UI scaffolding for the upcoming visual debugger. The framework will be able to communicate with the backend simulator through a secure IPC or RPC channel, enabling bidirectional exchange of transaction data, contract states, and validation results. By the end of this milestone, the extension will support loading user projects, initializing analysis sessions, and displaying script information, forming the backbone of the final debugging experience.

sub_fields.answer: Visual Debugger Implementation (Weeks 7–9)

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer: This milestone implements the core innovation of the project — a visual, step-by-step debugger for Plutus scripts. The debugger will allow users to inspect transactions, UTXOs, datums, redeemers, and validator execution states during each phase of contract validation. The interface will display execution traces and evaluation results, helping developers understand contract behavior and diagnose failures. This milestone also integrates breakpoint support, error visualization, and minimal UI animations for clarity. A working demo will be able to debug simple validator scripts, proving the feasibility of scaling to more complex contracts.

Error feedback and visual trace output presented clearly within the extension interface.
